p: As plant antioxidants, phenols can inhibit lipid peroxidation and exhibit various physiological activities [ 61]. Modeling the role of these natural antioxidants in defense mechanisms and adaptation processes has led to their use in the field of nutrition and human health. Widely used in the prevention and treatment of many chronic diseases such as cardiovascular conditions, diabetes, and cancer [ 62], polyphenols and phenol-rich plant extracts are also commercially used in the food and beverage industries as natural additives to control pathogenic and corrosive bacteria.
